page.title: 15FARMING,CATTLE
page.content: In order to reduce depemdence upon a single animal reared for one purpose only, there has been an attempt to diversify the activities of CNEWR ESTATES Ltd. (as the farm is now known) into both cattle farming and forestry. Modern cattle rearing dates from 1957 with the development of a suckler herd. This started as a herd of Hereford cows, but experiments in crossing with a Galloway bull were successful in producing hardy animals better suited to these exposed and wet hills. From 1980 a herd of pure Galloway cattle has lso been run on the higher ground. The cattle calve in autumn before being housed for the winter. The intention is to increase the size of the herds to about 500 head of cattle, about double the present size.
